Hi, I'm Jo.

I am a Front End Web Developer looking to create beautiful and functional websites and web applications. With experience using Squarespace and WordPress, I'm looking to use what I've learned about coding and programming to do more for my clients.

See Portfolio
About Jo

My name is Jonayah Marie Jackson. Everyone calls me Jo. I'm a front end web developer with a background in graphic design, project management, and data analysis/visualization in higher education. At my last position, I wore many hats, and as such, I was responsible for maintaining my team's webpages on the college's website for the better part of two years. It even led me to begin creating basic websites on popular hosting sites like Squarespace and WordPress as a freelancer. The websites that I was creating for my clients made me want to know more that just how to copy and paste random bits of code here and there.

Having recently earned a Certificate in Software Engineering from Columbia University, I want to use my knowledge to combine research and creativity to develop user-friendly applications and websites that center facts and learning. Because of that drive, I became known amongst the staff for beautiful visuals and data-driven deliverables for every project.

Experience

Freelance Front-End Web Developer

Think Halcyon, LLC

For the past few years, I have been creating and maintining static sites using website builders like Squarespace and WordPress for various clients.

2017 - Present

Project Manager

Center on Culture, Race & Equity (CCRE) at Bank Street College of Education

As project manager, I wore many hats. I maintained the CCRE webpages, co-facilitated professional development for educators in NY and NJ, and managed multiple research projects, which included data analysis and visualization.

2016 - 2020

Program Associate

Early Childhood Leadership Institute at SCO/FirstStep NYC

As project associate, I was responsible for designing program materials, taking all event photos, and acting as a member of the school leadership team.

2015 - 2016

Columbia University

Learned full stack web development with a focus on the MERN Stack (Mongoose, Express, React, Node). Known languages are HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Williams College

Anthropology major, Africana Studies minor, winner of the first annual Professor Ernest K. Brown Performing Arts Award
